m_szDocSumamry: Public Utilities & Private Companies In Mexico Teaming Up To Promote Renewables March 24th, 2014 by James Ayre   The Federal Electricity Commission — the general director of Mexico’s state-owned electric utility — recently announced its plans to further promote renewable energy production within the populous country by teaming up with a number of notable private companies. These new strategic public-private partnerships are intended as a sort of ‘reform’ of the country’s electric industry — with the aim being to maximize the potential of renewable energy projects there.
